title: MySQLLOG()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLLOG()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return the natural logarithm of 2:
SELECT LOG(2);

Definition and Usage
The LOG() function returns the natural logarithm of a specified
number
, or the logarithm of 
the
number
to the 
specified
base
.
Note:
See also the
LN()
and
EXP()
functions.
Syntax
LOG(
number
)
OR:
LOG(
base, number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. A number. Must be greater than 0
base
The base of
number
. Must be greater 
    than 1
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return the natural logarithm of 4 to a specified base (2):
SELECT LOG(2, 4);

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLLOG()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLLOG()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLLOG()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
